title: Psychological Safety in Virtual Teams
description: A quick, practical guide to Psychological Safety in Virtual Teams.

hook.text: Google's Project Aristotle found one factor above all that predicts team success: psychological safety.

buildup.text: Amy Edmondson defined it: the belief that you won't be punished for speaking up, asking, or failing.

discovery.text: In remote teams, psychological safety is harder to build because informal cues â€” smiles, nods â€” are missing.

twist.text: Leaders set the tone. A manager who admits mistakes publicly creates safety for the whole team.

climax.text: Techniques: normalize 'I don't know,' celebrate failed experiments, and use round-robin to hear every voice.

punchline.text: Safety isn't the absence of conflict. It's the presence of trust.
